headline.main: World Briefing | Asia: Nepal: Rebels Attack Again

lead_paragraph: Maoist rebels answered the government's decision to mobilize the army against them with another attack on a police post, killing four policemen and wounding six others about 250 miles west of the capital, Katmandu. More than 280 people have been killed in the conflict since Friday. The government hopes a newly declared state of emergency, which suspends most civil liberties and allows use of the army, will help quell the rebellion, which has spread to about a third of the impoverished nation's districts. Celia W. Dugger (NYT)
abstract: Maoist rebels in Nepal attack another police post, killing four policemen and wounding six others; government hopes newly declared state of emergency will help quell rebellion, which has spread to about third of nation's districts (S)
